title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: A little man stepped inside and said   Good evening  Mistress Miller  why are you crying so   ~newline~ The little man said   What will you give me if I spin it for you   ~newline~ The little man took the necklace  sat down before the spinning wheel  and whir  whir  whir  three times pulled  and the spool was full  ~newline~ Once again the door opened  and the little man appeared  ~newline~ The little man took the ring  and began once again to whir with the spinning wheel  ~newline~ When the girl was alone the little man returned for a third time  ~newline~  Who knows what will happen   thought the miller s daughter  and not knowing what else to do  she promised the little man what he demanded  ~newline~ In return the little man once again spun the straw into gold  ~newline~ She thought no more about the little man  but suddenly he appeared in her room and said   Now give me that which you promised   ~newline~ The queen took fright and offered the little man all the wealth of the kingdom if he would let her keep the child  but the little man said   No  ~newline~ Then the queen began lamenting and crying so much that the little man took pity on her and said   I will give you three days  time  ~newline~ When the little man returned the next day she began with Kaspar  Melchior  Balzer  and said in order all the names she knew  ~newline~ After each one the little man said   That is not my name   ~newline~ She recited the most unusual and most curious names to the little man   Is your name perhaps Beastrib  ~newline~ On the third day the messenger returned and said   I have not been able to find a single new name  but when I was approaching a high mountain in the corner of the woods  there where the fox and the hare say good night  I saw a little house  ~newline~ A fire was burning in front of the house  and an altogether comical little man was jumping around the fire  hopping on one leg and calling out  Today I ll bake  tomorrow I ll brew  Then I ll fetch the queen s new child  It is good that no one knows  Rumpelstiltskin is my name  ~newline~ Soon afterward the little man came in and asked   Now  Madame Queen  what is my name   ~newline~ shouted the little man  and with anger he stomped his right foot so hard into the ground that he fell in up to his waist

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: Now it happened that he got into a conversation with the king  and to make an impression on him he said   I have a daughter who can spin straw into gold   ~newline~ The king said to the miller   That is an art that I really like  ~newline~ Giving her a spinning wheel and a reel  he said   Get to work now  ~newline~ A little man stepped inside and said   Good evening  Mistress Miller  why are you crying so   ~newline~ The little man said   What will you give me if I spin it for you   ~newline~  My necklace   said the girl  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw into gold for you   ~newline~ He had the miller s daughter taken to a still larger room filled with straw  and said   Tonight you must spin this too  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw this time   ~newline~ She thought no more about the little man  but suddenly he appeared in her room and said   Now give me that which you promised   ~newline~ The queen took fright and offered the little man all the wealth of the kingdom if he would let her keep the child  but the little man said   No  ~newline~ Then the queen began lamenting and crying so much that the little man took pity on her and said   I will give you three days  time  ~newline~ When the little man returned the next day she began with Kaspar  Melchior  Balzer  and said in order all the names she knew  ~newline~ After each one the little man said   That is not my name   ~newline~ On the third day the messenger returned and said   I have not been able to find a single new name  but when I was approaching a high mountain in the corner of the woods  there where the fox and the hare say good night  I saw a little house

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: Now it happened that he got into a conversation with the king  and to make an impression on him he said   I have a daughter who can spin straw into gold   ~newline~ When the girl was brought to him he led her into a room that was entirely filled with straw  ~newline~ Spin all night  and if by morning you have not spun this straw into gold  then you will have to die   ~newline~ She had no idea how to spin straw into gold  ~newline~  Oh   answered the girl   I am supposed to spin straw into gold  and I do not know how to do it   ~newline~ So it went until morning  and then all the straw was spun  and all the spools were filled with gold  ~newline~ He had the miller s daughter taken to another room filled with straw  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw into gold for you   ~newline~ By morning he had spun all the straw into glistening gold  ~newline~ He had the miller s daughter taken to a still larger room filled with straw  and said   Tonight you must spin this too  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw this time   ~newline~ In return the little man once again spun the straw into gold

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: If by then you know my name  then you shall keep your child   ~newline~ The queen spent the entire night thinking of all the names she had ever heard  ~newline~ Then she sent a messenger into the country to inquire far and wide what other names there were  ~newline~ When the little man returned the next day she began with Kaspar  Melchior  Balzer  and said in order all the names she knew  ~newline~ After each one the little man said   That is not my name   ~newline~ The second day she sent inquiries into the neighborhood as to what names people had  ~newline~ She recited the most unusual and most curious names to the little man   Is your name perhaps Beastrib  ~newline~ But he always answered   That is not my name   ~newline~ On the third day the messenger returned and said   I have not been able to find a single new name  but when I was approaching a high mountain in the corner of the woods  there where the fox and the hare say good night  I saw a little house  ~newline~ A fire was burning in front of the house  and an altogether comical little man was jumping around the fire  hopping on one leg and calling out  Today I ll bake  tomorrow I ll brew  Then I ll fetch the queen s new child  It is good that no one knows  Rumpelstiltskin is my name  ~newline~ You can imagine how happy the queen was when she heard that name  ~newline~ Soon afterward the little man came in and asked   Now  Madame Queen  what is my name   ~newline~ She first asked   Is your name Kunz   ~newline~  Is your name Heinz   ~newline~  Is your name perhaps Rumpelstiltskin

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: Now it happened that he got into a conversation with the king  and to make an impression on him he said   I have a daughter who can spin straw into gold   ~newline~ Spin all night  and if by morning you have not spun this straw into gold  then you will have to die   ~newline~ She had no idea how to spin straw into gold  ~newline~  Oh   answered the girl   I am supposed to spin straw into gold  and I do not know how to do it   ~newline~ So it went until morning  and then all the straw was spun  and all the spools were filled with gold  ~newline~ At sunrise the king came  and when he saw the gold he was surprised and happy  but his heart became even more greedy for gold  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw into gold for you   ~newline~ By morning he had spun all the straw into glistening gold  ~newline~ The king was happy beyond measure when he saw it  but he still did not have his fill of gold  ~newline~ In return the little man once again spun the straw into gold

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: Now it happened that he got into a conversation with the king  and to make an impression on him he said   I have a daughter who can spin straw into gold   ~newline~ Giving her a spinning wheel and a reel  he said   Get to work now  ~newline~ She had no idea how to spin straw into gold  ~newline~  Oh   answered the girl   I am supposed to spin straw into gold  and I do not know how to do it   ~newline~ The little man said   What will you give me if I spin it for you   ~newline~ The little man took the necklace  sat down before the spinning wheel  and whir  whir  whir  three times pulled  and the spool was full  ~newline~ It was even larger  and he ordered her to spin it in one night  if she valued her life  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw into gold for you   ~newline~ The little man took the ring  and began once again to whir with the spinning wheel  ~newline~ He had the miller s daughter taken to a still larger room filled with straw  and said   Tonight you must spin this too  ~newline~ He said   What will you give me if I spin the straw this time

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: rumpelstiltskin Jacob and Wilhelm grimm Once upon a time there was a miller who was poor  but who had a beautiful daughter  ~newline~ Now it happened that he got into a conversation with the king  and to make an impression on him he said   I have a daughter who can spin straw into gold   ~newline~ If your daughter is as skillful as you say  then bring her to my castle tomorrow  and I will put her to the test   ~newline~ The poor miller s daughter sat there  and for her life she did not know what to do  ~newline~ He had the miller s daughter taken to another room filled with straw  ~newline~ He had the miller s daughter taken to a still larger room filled with straw  and said   Tonight you must spin this too  ~newline~ He thought   Even if she is only a miller s daughter  I will not find a richer wife in all the world   ~newline~  Who knows what will happen   thought the miller s daughter  and not knowing what else to do  she promised the little man what he demanded  ~newline~ When in the morning the king came and found everything just as he desired  he married her  and the beautiful miller s daughter became queen

sentence: When the little man returned the next day she began with Kaspar  Melchior  Balzer  and said in order all the names she knew  ~newline~ On the third day the messenger returned and said   I have not been able to find a single new name  but when I was approaching a high mountain in the corner of the woods  there where the fox and the hare say good night  I saw a little house  ~newline~ A fire was burning in front of the house  and an altogether comical little man was jumping around the fire  hopping on one leg and calling out  Today I ll bake  tomorrow I ll brew  Then I ll fetch the queen s new child  It is good that no one knows  Rumpelstiltskin is my name

title: Rumplestiltskin
sentence: She recited the most unusual and most curious names to the little man   Is your name perhaps Beastrib  ~newline~  Is your name perhaps Rumpelstiltskin
